title: Vertically align input area, reduce padding, and hide message IDs visually

requirements.text: Vertically align all elements within the chat message input area (text input, buttons, character count indicator) so they are centered on the same vertical axis.

quotes: Vertically align the input area elements

acceptanceCriteria: All elements in the chat input area (text field, send button, attachment buttons, character count indicator) are vertically centered relative to each other.
No elements appear misaligned or offset vertically in the input row.
Character count indicator and all action buttons (Reply, React, Share) remain present and functional.

requirements.text: Reduce the vertical padding inside the chat message input area to make it more compact without removing any existing controls.

quotes: Reduce vertical padding in the chat input area

acceptanceCriteria: The vertical padding (top and bottom) of the chat input container is visibly reduced compared to the current version.
No controls are removed — character count indicator and all action buttons (Reply, React, Share) remain.
Input area does not feel cramped or cause overflow.

requirements.text: Hide message ID text visually within message bubbles by making it invisible (e.g., via CSS), while keeping the element in the DOM so that share link functionality continues to work.

quotes: Hide message IDs visually (keeping them in the DOM for share links)

acceptanceCriteria: Message ID text is not visible to the user inside message bubbles.
The message ID element is still present in the DOM (not removed via conditional rendering).
Share link functionality that relies on message IDs continues to work correctly.
Reply, React, and Share action buttons remain visible and functional.

constraints: Do not remove the character count indicator from the message input area.
Do not remove or hide the Reply, React, or Share action buttons on message bubbles.
Message ID elements must remain in the DOM — only hide them visually.
nonGoals: Changing any backend logic or data models.
Modifying share link URL format or message ID encoding.
Redesigning or restyling any part of the UI beyond the three specified changes.
Altering message bubble layout beyond hiding message IDs.
